text: a truck has crashed into a department
store Swedish radio is reporting that at
least two people have been killed police
have sealed off part of the city center
after the truck was driven into
pedestrians through a pedestrianised
area of the city's not clear as yet if
the action was deliberate but we are
hearing reports from the ground that
shots were fired witnesses at the scene
say they saw what appeared to be bodies
lying in the street covered by blankets
I'm also hearing from our security
correspondent Frank Gardner that shots
have been fired in another part of
Stockholm from where the truck attack
took place so further away so it is
possible that there are two incidents
ongoing at the moment in Stockholm this
is a picture of that central shopping
district you can see that there are now
no cars no people on the street we've
seen pictures on Twitter of armed police
circulating in the area and there is
also a still footage on social media of
this truck in the corner of the building
it's plowed into an upmarket department
store and looking at that picture how
far it's gone in you would have to
suggest that it was going at some speed
let's bring in Richard Galpin who's been
following events for us and obviously
this has only been breaking the last
hour so details are a little bit sketchy
at the moment but what else can you add
to that well I think the key thing we're
hearing now is apparently the subway in
Stockholm has been closed down and I
think that looks like another indication
that this is some kind of attack of
course we do not know for sure we're
still waiting for confirmation from the
police but we certainly know that the
national radio broadcasters reports
saying that the true police are treating
it as a terrorist attack but we're still
waiting for that confirmation but as you
say I mean there's there are now reports
of shots being fired and the fact that
they've closed down the subway would
indicate that they are concerned that
potentially people are on the loose in
the city who they would want to try and
arrest the swedish prime minister
according to reuters is just saying that
sweden has been attacked everything
indicating it is an act of terrorism
and I mentioned Frank dog and security
correspondent saying that there was a
second into the possibly under way we've
heard a number of reports about that a
little bit further away we think from
that pedestrianised area yes we don't
have any more details on that at all so
it's very difficult to actually give any
more information at this stage but as
you said to me the fact that the Prime
Minister the governments are now saying
if it does look like this is a terrorist
attack obviously it comes in the context
of what happened here in London a couple
of weeks ago and there are real fears
now across Europe about this pattern
that is emerging of vehicles being used
as weapons and if you remember at the
time of the westminster attack people
talked about the fear of copycat attacks
at the time obviously we were thinking
what might happen in this country but
this does look very much to be very
similar style attack but using a huge
lorry as you're saying in that
photograph there's a still photograph
where you can see it's a very big lorry
which has gone into the side of a
building has obviously smashed in gone
quite a long way in so this was using a
very heavy big vehicle which obviously
could cause very significant casualties
and I've seen that for myself in me so I
was reporting to the BBC down there 86
people killed by this trunk which was
careering down the promenade on the
front and it's there's very little you
can do to stop them immediate and from
this area and swing their arms barriers
in place so unless he did smash them or
until that point that it had smashed
into the department's or there's nothing
much you can do no I mean you can't have
barriers or bollards which you're going
to stop vehicles going through right the
way through a city centre it's
impossible to do that and you know with
a lorry this big as well it would have
enormous momentum would be able to break
through barricades you have thoughts so
it's but it's very very difficult to
protect absolutely everywhere
